summary: This bill, the 9/11 Memorial and Museum Act, proposes a one-time grant to the National September 11 Memorial & Museum for operation, security, and maintenance. The Secretary of Homeland Security will award the grant, with the amount determined based on the museum's needs and visitor benefits. The bill mandates free admission for certain groups, weekly free hours for the public, and annual audits. The entity receiving the grant must also submit annual reports on fund usage. No additional funds are authorized beyond the initial appropriations.
